newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Da Gama sees 97/98 earnings little changed.
newsitem.headline: Da Gama sees 97/98 earnings little changed.

text.p: Da Gama Textile Co Ltd said on Monday that it expected earnings in the coming year to be little changed from those in the year to March 31 1997, despite an expected increase in sales volumes.

In a statement accompanying results which showed attributable earnings down 26 percent to 42.6 cents a share, the company said its current order book suggested a modest improvement in sales volumes in the year ahead.
"However, earnings are expected to approximate those of the year under review as a result of the cessation of certain decentralisation allowances and a higher effective tax rate."
The company said earnings in the past year had been affected by a high level of fabric and garment imports as well as soft consumer demand, which had led to increase competition among local mills.
Da Gama shares were untraded on the Johannesburg Stock Exchange at 224 cents each.
